p: In research conducted by Wang et al., the authors described the testing of COVID-19 in 1070 specimens from 205 infected patients using rRT-PCR. Investigators detected COVID-19 RNA in lung wash (14 of 15 samples; 93%), sputum (72 of 104; 72%), nasal swabs (5 of 8; 63 %), lung biopsy (6 of 13; 46 %), throat swabs (126 of 398; 32 %), feces (44 of 153; 29 %), and blood (3 of 307; 1 %). The 72 urine specimens all tested negative [ 39].
